titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Connecticut Miscellaneous Manuscripts Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr. and John Espy

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 08:31

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: An artificial collection of material relating to the cities and towns of Connecticut, containing printed material, legal records, military papers, and miscellanea. Specific items include: deeds, indentures, leases, military commissions, enrollment lists, record books, and muster rolls.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Connecticut Miscellaneous Manuscripts Collection (MS 149). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in four series: I. State Files. II. Military Files. III. Cities and Towns. IV. Numerical Files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An artificial collection of material relating to the cities and towns of Connecticut, containing printed material, legal records, military papers, and miscellanea. Specific items include: deeds, indentures, leases, military commissions, enrollment lists, record books, and muster rolls.

No.1: Various names (A-Z) of people born before 1760 in the towns of Fairfield, Greenfield, Poquonock, West Farms Upper, West Farms, Northfield, and Easton
No.2: New Haven/Friends, Society of: Monthly Meeting of Friends
No.3: Canaan/Rockwell family: correspondence, legal and financial papers, and papers concerning schools
No.4: New Haven/Taft Hotel: ALS from Charles P. Taft to Henry Stoddard Johnson
